title: Woolworth Building
summary: The Woolworth Building is an early American skyscraper designed by architect Cass Gilbert located at 233 Broadway in the Tribeca neighborhood of Manhattan in New York City. It was the tallest building in the world from 1913 to 1930, with a height of 792 feet (241Â m). More than a century after its construction, it remains one of the 100 tallest buildings in the United States.
